results:
Based on my search results, I found information about various stage productions and theatrical adaptations of "The Old Man and the Sea" worldwide. Here's what I discovered:

## Opera Adaptations

A contemporary opera adaptation of "The Old Man and the Sea" has been created by Paola Prestini, Royce Vavrek, and Karmina Šilec, described as "the first-ever approved operatic adaptation of Ernest Hemingway's novel."(no content)This opera reimagines Hemingway's story with a dual track of storytelling that combines the original novel with portraits of everyday life to explore themes of aging, legacy, and our relationship to the sea.(no content)The opera was commissioned by multiple organizations including Beth Morrison Projects, Carolina Performing Arts at the University of North Carolina, VisionIntoArt, Krannert Center of Performing Arts, and Arizona State University Gammage.(no content)The opera recording was released on VIA Records on August 30, 2024.

## Stage Adaptations

Several theatrical stage adaptations have been produced:

**Pittsburgh Playhouse Production (2019)**: Point Park University presented a world premiere stage adaptation in collaboration with RWS Entertainment Group, staged at the Highmark Theatre in Pittsburgh from February 1-17, 2019.(no content)The cast featured Tony Award-winning actor Anthony Crivello as Santiago, David Cabot as Hemingway, and Gabriel Florentino as Manolin.

**Long Wharf Theatre Production**: A stage adaptation opened at the Long Wharf Theatre on April 8, adapted by Craig Siebels and Eric Ting, with performances running through April 26 in New Haven, Connecticut.(no content)The cast included Matteo Gomez as the Old Man, Rey Lucas as the Boy, and Leajato Robinson as Cienfuegos.

## International Performances

Director Karmina Šilec, who worked on the opera adaptation, has performed projects "on stages and festivals of the highest esteem, including the Festival d'Automne á Paris (FR), Ruhrtriennale (DE), Prototype Festival NYC (USA), Holland Festival (NL), Moscow Easter Festival (RU), Dresdner Musikfestspiele (DE), Golden Mask (RU), Melbourne Festival (AU), Operadagen (NL), Auditorium, Rome (IT), Steierischer Herbst (AT), Tokyo Metropolitan Art Space (JP)."

## Performance Details

The opera features soprano, countertenor, bass baritone, chorus, cellist, percussion, and electronics, with specific performers including Armando Contreras as Hemingway/Santiago, GRAMMY-nominated soprano Measha Brueggergosman Lee as La Mar, countertenor Rodolfo Girón as Manolin, and soprano Yvette Keong as La Virgen del Cobre.

The search results show that while there have been multiple film adaptations of the work, the contemporary opera by Prestini appears to be the most significant recent theatrical adaptation, with various stage productions emerging in recent years across different venues in the United States.
